title: WHIRLING F1 / GARTE
description: ltn Kitsuragi suggests you talk to the manager of the Whirling-in-Rags first. Garte is a hub of knowledge on the area and the case and you will come back to him later. He is also a problem, asking you to pay for the night, to pay for "the damages". It does not reflect well on you.

dialogueTree.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "A man in his late twenties with a t..."
dialogueTree.text: A man in his late twenties with a thin, unimpressive beard notices you approaching. He drops the ledger he was holding and turns to the lieutenant.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Mr... Garte, right?" The lieutenan..."
links.text: "Mr... Garte, right?" The lieutenant glances into his little notebook. "You run this place?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes," he responds tersely."
links.text: "Yes," he responds tersely.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I am Kim Kitsuragi from Precinct 5..."
links.text: "I am Kim Kitsuragi from Precinct 57. This is an inter-district investigation, so joining me from Precinct 41..." He looks to you, realizing he still doesn't know your name.

links.title: You: ""The harbinger of ruin.""
links.text: "The harbinger of ruin."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What?""
links.text: "What?"

links.title: You: ""Nothing. I just wanted to see what..."
links.text: "Nothing. I just wanted to see what happens if I say that. Now I do."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What is this, a joke to you? Is *t..."
links.text: "What is this, a joke to you? Is *this* what you get when you call the police now? *This* guy?" He turns to the lieutenant. "We've been waiting for a week here!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Sir, I understand your concern, bu..."
links.text: "Sir, I understand your concern, but we're here to do a job, and for us to do it, I need you to stay calm."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes, of course." He takes a step b..."
links.text: "Yes, of course." He takes a step back.

links.title: Authority: "For a moment, the Cafeteria Manager..."
links.text: For a moment, the Cafeteria Manager fidgets under the lieutenant's gaze. Then he gives in.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I know it took us a while to arriv..."
links.text: "I know it took us a while to arrive at the scene. But it also took you a while to call us. It was you who placed the call, correct?"

links.title: Authority: "For a moment, the man fidgets under..."
links.text: For a moment, the man fidgets under the lieutenant's gaze. Then he gives in.

links.title: You: ""The gloaming. I *am* it.""
links.text: "The gloaming. I *am* it."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I have *no idea* what that means.""
links.text: "I have *no idea* what that means."

links.title: You: ""I have been to the precipice. I ha..."
links.text: "I have been to the precipice. I have seen the end."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What is this, a joke to you? Is *t..."
links.text: "What is this, a joke to you? Is *this* what you get when you call the police now? *This* guy?" He points at you. "We've been waiting for a week here!"

links.title: You: ""This duskland will be gone soon. I..."
links.text: "This duskland will be gone soon. It makes no difference if you understand or not."

links.title: You: ""Never mind.""
links.text: "Never mind."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Never mind? *Gloaming*? What is th..."
links.text: "Never mind? *Gloaming*? What is this? Is *this* what you get when you call the police now?" He points at you. "*This* guy? Lieutenant, we've been waiting for a week here!"

links.title: You: ""Never mind.""
links.text: "Never mind."

links.title: You: ""As I said, Detective Raphaël Ambro..."
links.text: "As I said, Detective Raphaël Ambrosius Costeau."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Right... Now, I know it took us a..."
links.text: "Right... Now, I know it took us a while to arrive at the scene. It also took you a while to call us and report the dead body -- it *was* you who placed the call, yes?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, I only just got here. It was p..."
links.text: "No, I only just got here. It was probably Sylvie who called you. She usually works the bar here. I'm only temporarily taking over her duties."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Do you have her number?""
links.text: "Do you have her number?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""As a matter of fact, I do." He loo..."
links.text: "As a matter of fact, I do." He looks behind a pile of coasters, finds a slip of paper, and hands it to the lieutenant.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "This sounds like something you can..."
links.text: This sounds like something you can *use* -- to call this Sylvie later...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You said you just got here -- from..."
links.text: "You said you just got here -- from where? Are you a local?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What? Of Martinaise -- no. I live..."
links.text: "What? Of Martinaise -- no. I live in Jamrock. I only *sometimes* come here to keep an eye on the place. This is just one of the many, many cafeterias I manage."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But you still know your way around..."
links.text: "But you still know your way around, yes? In case we need directions."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes, I know where *some* things ar..."
links.text: "Yes, I know where *some* things are. But, as I said, I don't live here. I just used to work here. And I'm not going to start working here again, if that's what you think."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I didn't imply that." He turns to..."
links.text: "I didn't imply that." He turns to you. "Detective?"

links.title: Logic: "He probably means this is where you..."
links.text: He probably means this is where you step in and ask your questions.

links.title: You: ""Right then. Questions. I got this.""
links.text: "Right then. Questions. I got this."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "His face expresses profound doubt i..."
links.text: His face expresses profound doubt in your *having this*.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Ask him about the body's location *..."
links.text: Ask him about the body's location *before* asking if he killed him. People give up information in the more innocuous questions, which you can later use in the more sinister ones, not vice versa.

links.title: You: ""Who, me?""
links.text: "Who, me?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, Detective Costeau." He says t..."
links.text: "Yes, Detective Costeau." He says the name with a purposefully straight face. "I have everything. You?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Mhm." He checks his little noteboo..."
links.text: "Mhm." He checks his little notebook. "I have everything. You?"

links.title: You: ""No, I'm good." (Pass on the questi..."
links.text: "No, I'm good." (Pass on the questions.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant nods at you affirmat..."
links.text: The lieutenant nods at you affirmatively, then glances at the exit. "The body was behind the building, right -- how do we get there?"

links.title: You: ""Yes?""
links.text: "Yes?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I have everything. You?" He looks..."
links.text: "I have everything. You?" He looks in his little notebook.

links.title: You: ""Oh, you mean, do I have *questions..."
links.text: "Oh, you mean, do I have *questions*?" (Ask them.)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes, yes, he means do you have que..."
links.text: "Yes, yes, he means do you have questions for me. Like a police officer would." The cafeteria manager is clearly agitated again.

links.title: Drama: "He thinks you're stupid, sire."
links.text: He thinks you're stupid, sire.

links.title: You: ""What?""
links.text: "What?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's your turn." He takes a respec..."
links.text: "It's your turn." He takes a respectful little step back.

links.title: You: ""Oh, you mean questions?""
links.text: "Oh, you mean questions?"

links.title: You: ""Who, me?""
links.text: "Who, me?"

links.title: You: ""What is gold and orange like a for..."
links.text: "What is gold and orange like a forest fire, but smells like liquor?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Are you kidding me?""
links.text: "Are you kidding me?"

links.title: You: ""No, man. Help me out: what is gold..."
links.text: "No, man. Help me out: what is golden-orange and smells like liquor?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""It's you, it's obviously you. *You..."
links.text: "It's you, it's obviously you. *You* smell like liquor. And you're orange."

links.title: Conceptualization: "See -- everyone agrees it's your co..."
links.text: See -- everyone agrees it's your colour scheme. We're on the right track with this name thing.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He turns to the lieutenant. "Is thi..."
links.text: He turns to the lieutenant. "Is this what you get when you call the police now? We've been waiting for a week here!"

links.title: You: "Kim is about to say something. Let..."
links.text: Kim is about to say something. Let him.

links.title: You: ""I'm currently in-between names.""
links.text: "I'm currently in-between names."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Fantastic.""
links.text: "Fantastic."

links.title: You: ""It's like when you've left your ba..."
links.text: "It's like when you've left your band, but you haven't decided on a solo artist name yet."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""That's wonderful! Really. I think..."
links.text: "That's wonderful! Really. I think so. But there's a dead body out back. No one wants to work in these conditions! It's been a week!"

links.title: You: "Kim is about to say something. Let..."
links.text: Kim is about to say something. Let him.

links.title: You: ""It's probably Harry.""
links.text: "It's probably Harry."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What's that supposed to mean -- pr..."
links.text: "What's that supposed to mean -- probably?"

links.title: You: ""It means I'm not ruling out "Harry..."
links.text: "It means I'm not ruling out "Harry" at this juncture."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What is this, a joke to you? There..."
links.text: "What is this, a joke to you? There's a dead body out back, and it's been there for a week now! No one wants to work in these conditions!"

links.title: You: ""I have forgotten my name.""
links.text: "I have forgotten my name."

links.title: You: ""I don't like your tone.""
links.text: "I don't like your tone."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""And I don't like the dead body tha..."
links.text: "And I don't like the dead body that's been hanging out there for a week!" He gestures somewhere outside. "No one wants to work in these conditions!"

links.title: You: ""Can I have a drink?""
links.text: "Can I have a drink?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No," he leans in for emphasis, "yo..."
links.text: "No," he leans in for emphasis, "you cannot."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Officer... I was thinking more alo..."
links.text: "Officer... I was thinking more along the lines of your name."

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Empathy: "Could he be irritated with you? He..."
links.text: Could he be irritated with you? He avoids eye contact altogether. Like you're not even there.

dialogueTree.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "The man plucks at the seabird, frow..."
dialogueTree.text: The man plucks at the seabird, frowning.

links.title: You: ""What's wrong? Don't you like The O..."
links.text: "What's wrong? Don't you like The Officer?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh no," he says without looking up..."
links.text: "Oh no," he says without looking up. "You're a hero. A real hero cop."

links.title: Logic: "Could the massive property damage u..."
links.text: Could the massive property damage upstairs have anything to do with this?

links.title: You: ""Wait, did you just say I was a *co..."
links.text: "Wait, did you just say I was a *cop*?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What kind of question is that?""
links.text: "What kind of question is that?"

links.title: You: ""I didn't know I was a cop. Are you..."
links.text: "I didn't know I was a cop. Are you sure?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I don't know. Am I?" He looks at y..."
links.text: "I don't know. Am I?" He looks at you, taking stock of your cop-ness and finding it lacking.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Not far from here a 34-year-old man..."
links.text: Not far from here a 34-year-old man called Jean Vicquemare reluctantly picks his facial hair while a dark-haired woman in an officer's suit waits for an answer. A typical police station morning hums in the background: telephones ringing, the whirr of a roll'o'dex...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: ""Have you seen the way he dresses?"..."
links.text: "Have you seen the way he dresses?" The man asks. "It's like he's not even a cop anymore. Shows up in here looking like a clown, reeking of alcohol. Screams at everyone... I'm done with that guy."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: ""Let him sort it out for himself.""
links.text: "Let him sort it out for himself."

links.title: You: ""That makes sense. Ever since I got..."
links.text: "That makes sense. Ever since I got up, I've felt something in me..." (Look at your hands and feel it flowing through your veins.) "Now I know it's *The Law*."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Are you serious right now?""
links.text: "Are you serious right now?"

links.title: You: ""The responsibility has taken its t..."
links.text: "The responsibility has taken its toll on my body, but I will take up the mantle once more. This is who I am."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I really don't know what to say to..."
links.text: "I really don't know what to say to that." He looks down at the seabird.

links.title: You: ""Of course -- if by "The Law" you m..."
links.text: "Of course -- if by "The Law" you mean *blood alcohol level*."

links.title: You: ""Of course I'm not serious.""
links.text: "Of course I'm not serious."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He looks down at the stuffed bird,..."
links.text: He looks down at the stuffed bird, quietly shaking his head.

links.title: You: ""I can't be a police officer... Thi..."
links.text: "I can't be a police officer... This is insane."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""It is, isn't it?" He looks at you,..."
links.text: "It is, isn't it?" He looks at you, shaking his head in disbelief.

links.title: You: ""Nothing. I just wanted to hear you..."
links.text: "Nothing. I just wanted to hear you say it."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He rolls his eyes."
links.text: He rolls his eyes.

links.title: You: ""So not only am I a cop, but I'm al..."
links.text: "So not only am I a cop, but I'm also a hero?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes, you are! A real decorated her..."
links.text: "Yes, you are! A real decorated hero."

links.title: You: ""What did I do?""
links.text: "What did I do?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What did you *not* do? First you t..."
links.text: "What did you *not* do? First you took the body down, then you solved the murder, then you *didn't* trash my hostel room. Maybe you even negotiated the strike..."

links.title: You: ""You're being sarcastic.""
links.text: "You're being sarcastic."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Am I? Or did you ride in, take the..."
links.text: "Am I? Or did you ride in, take the body down, solve the murder, and *not* trash my hostel room?"

links.title: You: ""Oh my god, I did all those things?""
links.text: "Oh my god, I did all those things?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No -- you see -- actually you didn..."
links.text: "No -- you see -- actually you didn't. You haven't done anything even remotely useful since you got here."

links.title: You: ""What have I been doing then? Have..."
links.text: "What have I been doing then? Have you seen me around?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, I haven't *seen you around*. I..."
links.text: "No, I haven't *seen you around*. I'm not always here." He looks down again and keeps plucking at the bird.

links.title: You: ""I'm guessing I didn't do any of th..."
links.text: "I'm guessing I didn't do any of those things?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You're right, you didn't. And it's..."
links.text: "You're right, you didn't. And it's only taken you *three days* not to."

links.title: You: ""What have I been doing all that ti..."
links.text: "What have I been doing all that time? Have you seen me around?"

links.title: You: ""I do not appreciate your tone. Thi..."
links.text: "I do not appreciate your tone. This is no way to talk to an officer."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh, it's not?!" He raises his shou..."
links.text: "Oh, it's not?!" He raises his shoulders like he's about to say something more, but then gets a hold of himself.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You're right. It's not.""
links.text: "You're right. It's not."

links.title: Authority: "He has no respect for you personall..."
links.text: He has no respect for you personally, but this man sees himself as a law-abiding citizen -- and you a representative of that law. He tries to avoid outright conflict.

links.title: You: ""I sense you're not a fan of mine.""
links.text: "I sense you're not a fan of mine."

links.title: You: ""Something tells me you don't like..."
links.text: "Something tells me you don't like me."

links.title: You: "Look at the stuffed bird."
links.text: Look at the stuffed bird.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "A competent work of taxidermy, the..."
links.text: A competent work of taxidermy, the white and brown seabird lies among piles of coasters and drying mugs, one of its wings broken. The man is trying to mend it.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "Looks like the bird was ripped off..."
links.text: Looks like the bird was ripped off the shield that was used to mount it -- most likely on a wall.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "This is a great skua. The seabird i..."
links.text: This is a great skua. The seabird is the symbol for the discovery of the Insulindian isola, the part of the world you are in right now.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "The small steel tag says as much: "..."
links.text: The small steel tag says as much: "The Great Skua (Stercorarius skua)."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Something about it makes you feel b..."
links.text: Something about it makes you feel bitter...

links.title: You: ""What happened to the bird?""
links.text: "What happened to the bird?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Look, your *buddy* is over there."..."
links.text: "Look, your *buddy* is over there." He looks at the doors, where a man in a bomber jacket is tapping his foot on the floor.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Why don't you go and talk to him,..."
links.text: "Why don't you go and talk to him, okay?"

links.title: You: ""What do you mean, 'my *buddy*'?""
links.text: "What do you mean, 'my *buddy*'?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He pretends not to hear you, concen..."
links.text: He pretends not to hear you, concentrating on the bird instead.

links.title: You: ""I talk to whomever I please.""
links.text: "I talk to whomever I please."

links.title: You: ""Can I help you with that?""
links.text: "Can I help you with that?"

links.title: You: ""That's the great skua, right?""
links.text: "That's the great skua, right?"

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "A small engraved steel tag says: "T..."
links.text: A small engraved steel tag says: "The Great Skua (Stercorarius skua)."

links.title: You: ""Are you the bartender?""
links.text: "Are you the bartender?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, I'm not the *bartender*. I'm t..."
links.text: "No, I'm not the *bartender*. I'm the cafeteria manager."

links.title: Composure: "He's very animated all of a sudden...."
links.text: He's very animated all of a sudden. This seems like a touchy subject.

links.title: You: ""What's the difference?""
links.text: "What's the difference?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I have *three* cafeterias I manage..."
links.text: "I have *three* cafeterias I manage. Three. Get over it."

links.title: You: ""Where exactly is the body?""
links.text: "Where exactly is the body?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Behind this building, there's a co..."
links.text: "Behind this building, there's a courtyard." He points to the kitchen behind him. "They hoisted him up on a tree there."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And how do we get there?""
links.text: "And how do we get there?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""See that door there?" He points we..."
links.text: "See that door there?" He points west, toward the pinball table. "Go out and turn right. There's a..." He pauses and sighs. "There's a big hole in the fence. No need for a key, just go through that hole and you'll be in the courtyard."

links.title: Empathy: "Are you supposed to feel guilty abo..."
links.text: Are you supposed to feel guilty about the hole? His sigh tells you: yes.

links.title: You: ""And how do we get there then?""
links.text: "And how do we get there then?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""That's easy! See that door there?"..."
links.text: "That's easy! See that door there?" He points to the west. "First you exit through that. Then to your right you should see a big hole in the fence -- a really big one. You can get to the courtyard through there. No need for the keys. The hole is big enough for the Franconigerian cavalry to fit through."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "This man means the heavy cavalry of..."
links.text: This man means the heavy cavalry of Innocence Franconegro, sweeping over the plains and nations of the enemies of mankind, 5th Century style. Unified currency and the concept of *cool* came in their wake. They wore lamellar and carried guns. But first and foremost, Franconigerian heavy cavalry was really, really wide. That hole in the fence must be *enormous*.

links.title: Empathy: "Does he want you to feel *guilty* o..."
links.text: Does he want you to feel *guilty* of making that hole? It's implied in his voice.

links.title: You: ""Do you have a fridge?""
links.text: "Do you have a fridge?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What?!""
links.text: "What?!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Khm..." The lieutenant coughs in y..."
links.text: "Khm..." The lieutenant coughs in your direction. "Not now."

links.title: Suggestion: "Now is not a good time to ask him a..."
links.text: Now is not a good time to ask him about the corpse-fridge.

links.title: You: ""Who killed him?""
links.text: "Who killed him?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I don't know who killed him, I'm n..."
links.text: "I don't know who killed him, I'm not the police. That's your job."

links.title: Rhetoric: "This is it! He said *they* hoisted..."
links.text: This is it! He said *they* hoisted him up on a tree -- who is this *they* if he doesn't know?

links.title: Reaction Speed: "He doesn't know? He just said "they..."
links.text: He doesn't know? He just said "they" hoisted him up on a tree -- who is this they?

links.title: You: ""Did you kill him?""
links.text: "Did you kill him?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What are you -- crazy? Of course I..."
links.text: "What are you -- crazy? Of course I didn't *kill* him."

links.title: Half Light: "Suddenly you tense up, blood is bei..."
links.text: Suddenly you tense up, blood is being pushed to your muscles. You should hound him on this, hound him *hard*, the prey drive says.

links.title: You: ""Did you kill him, Garte?""
links.text: "Did you kill him, Garte?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, I didn't.""
links.text: "No, I didn't."

links.title: You: ""You can tell me, Garte. You killed..."
links.text: "You can tell me, Garte. You killed him, right?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I didn't." He turns to the lieuten..."
links.text: "I didn't." He turns to the lieutenant: "I don't appreciate this. What is this?"

links.title: You: ""Why did you have to kill him?""
links.text: "Why did you have to kill him?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Do I have to answer him?" He asks..."
links.text: "Do I have to answer him?" He asks the lieutenant. "Is this mandatory?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant stands motionless, h..."
links.text: The lieutenant stands motionless, his expression unreadable.

links.title: You: ""Did he hurt you? Is that why? Did..."
links.text: "Did he hurt you? Is that why? Did you get some kind of sick *kick* out of killing him?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What are you, an idiot?! I told yo..."
links.text: "What are you, an idiot?! I told you I haven't killed anyone!"

links.title: You: ""Anyone? Have you killed someone el..."
links.text: "Anyone? Have you killed someone else then?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He ignores you."
links.text: He ignores you.

links.title: Half Light: "More. Press on, push through..."
links.text: More. Press on, push through...

links.title: You: ""Did you kill Sylvie?""
links.text: "Did you kill Sylvie?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Fuck you, man.""
links.text: "Fuck you, man."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's enough." You can't tell who..."
links.text: "That's enough." You can't tell who the remark is aimed at, you or Garte.

links.title: Empathy: "A very silent wave comes from the l..."
links.text: A very silent wave comes from the lieutenant, like the distant echo of a drum-roll. It's approval.

links.title: You: ""Okay. I believe you.""
links.text: "Okay. I believe you."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Thank you ever so much.""
links.text: "Thank you ever so much."

links.title: You: ""You have not entirely convinced me.""
links.text: "You have not entirely convinced me."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""That's a real pity." He stares ang..."
links.text: "That's a real pity." He stares angrily at you.

links.title: You: ""Okay, I'm not gonna hound you on t..."
links.text: "Okay, I'm not gonna hound you on this."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Isn't it a bit too late for that?""
links.text: "Isn't it a bit too late for that?"

links.title: You: ""Okay, I'm not gonna hound you on t..."
links.text: "Okay, I'm not gonna hound you on this."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh, thank you.""
links.text: "Oh, thank you."

links.title: You: ""Before you said *they* hoisted him..."
links.text: "Before you said *they* hoisted him up on a tree. Who did you mean by *they*?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh." He's a bit surprised you caug..."
links.text: "Oh." He's a bit surprised you caught that. "I meant the Union dockworkers. You know, the guys who *everyone* is saying killed him. Which no one is saying about me -- because I didn't."

links.title: You: ""Who is this everyone?""
links.text: "Who is this everyone?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""The locals. Customers, the people..."
links.text: "The locals. Customers, the people who eat here. A lot of dockworkers eat here. Sylvie told me everyone knows the dockworkers did it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Did the Débardeurs themselves tell..."
links.text: "Did the Débardeurs themselves tell her this, or is it a rumour?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I don't really know. You'll have t..."
links.text: "I don't really know. You'll have to ask her."

links.title: You: ""Why would the dockworkers lynch th..."
links.text: "Why would the dockworkers lynch this man?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I would suppose it's because they..."
links.text: "I would suppose it's because they have nothing better to do."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You mean the strike?""
links.text: "You mean the strike?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes, the *strike*," he makes littl..."
links.text: "Yes, the *strike*," he makes little quotation marks with his fingers. "The man they hanged was a security guard for the harbour company, I hear -- a mercenary. The unionistas probably thought they'd send a message."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh." He's a bit surprised you caug..."
links.text: "Oh." He's a bit surprised you caught that. "People are saying it was the Union dockworkers. That it was a lynching."

links.title: You: ""Who exactly is saying that?""
links.text: "Who exactly is saying that?"

links.title: You: ""I have another question.""
links.text: "I have another question."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant turns the page in th..."
links.text: The lieutenant turns the page in the little notebook he's been scribbling in.

links.title: You: ""Why did Sylvie go away?""
links.text: "Why did Sylvie go away?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Haven't you asked me that already?..."
links.text: "Haven't you asked me that already? What is it with you and this woman? She has nothing to do with this. "

links.title: You: ""No, before I asked you *where*. No..."
links.text: "No, before I asked you *where*. Now I'm asking you *why* she left."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Okay, you got me. She went away be..."
links.text: "Okay, you got me. She went away because of the dead body out back -- and because I asked for her number. That's why Sylvie went away. I hope you appreciate that..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Thank you," the lieutenant says. H..."
links.text: "Thank you," the lieutenant says. He opens his little notebook at the cover. The number is safely tucked away in a small pocket.

links.title: You: ""Mystery solved!""
links.text: "Mystery solved!"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Is it? Because I thought you were..."
links.text: "Is it? Because I thought you were supposed to be investigating the lynching, not my employer conduct."

links.title: You: ""This stuff gets on my nerves. I am..."
links.text: "This stuff gets on my nerves. I am a feminist."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What?""
links.text: "What?"

links.title: You: ""That's right. If there's one thing..."
links.text: "That's right. If there's one thing I know about myself it's that I'm a *total*, raging feminist."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Is that so? Mr. Feminist..." He ca..."
links.text: "Is that so? Mr. Feminist..." He catches the rest before it leaves his mouth, probably thinking it's best not to say anything.

links.title: Tutorial Agent: "You've gained a Thought! When this..."
links.text: You've gained a Thought! When this dialogue is over, go to your THOUGHT CABINET and INTERNALIZE it for special bonuses and effects.

links.title: You: ""You heard me.""
links.text: "You heard me."

links.title: You: ""Do you have a phallus in your ear?..."
links.text: "Do you have a phallus in your ear? I said I'm a feminist."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's good. But there is a timeta..."
links.text: "That's good. But there is a timetable for this investigation, dictated to us by the stages of decomposition. And it says we need to move on."

links.title: You: ""I'm not a feminist, I just wanted..."
links.text: "I'm not a feminist, I just wanted to see the look on your face."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What are you, a chauvinist then? H..."
links.text: "What are you, a chauvinist then? Hah!"

links.title: Rhetoric: "He smiles until he realizes his com..."
links.text: He smiles until he realizes his comeback wasn't very good. Then he frowns again.

links.title: You: ""I guess I like to be thorough.""
links.text: "I guess I like to be thorough."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Good for you. Was there something..."
links.text: "Good for you. Was there something else? I'd like to get back to what I was doing."

links.title: You: ""Everything has something to do wit..."
links.text: "Everything has something to do with everything."

links.title: You: ""I don't know. I just went for it.""
links.text: "I don't know. I just went for it."

links.title: You: ""You're right. I probably shouldn't..."
links.text: "You're right. I probably shouldn't have asked."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Forget it.""
links.text: "Forget it."

links.title: You: ""Didn't go well?""
links.text: "Didn't go well?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I asked an employee out. She didn'..."
links.text: "I asked an employee out. She didn't want to come, but felt obliged to. It was a bad idea. Now what is so god damn fascinating about that for you? It's got nothing to do with the lynching."

links.title: You: ""You're right.""
links.text: "You're right."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes, I am.""
links.text: "Yes, I am."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""She went away because *none of you..."
links.text: "She went away because *none of your business*."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Have they not been telling you you'..."
links.text: Have they not been telling you you're a cop?

links.title: You: ""She pertains to the coming apocaly..."
links.text: "She pertains to the coming apocalypse."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Does she? Maybe she does... maybe..."
links.text: "Does she? Maybe she does... maybe she *pertains* to the apocalypse." He snorts. "Sylvie is not here because I asked for her number. The dead body out back didn't help either, but it was mostly me. I hope you appreciate that..."

links.title: You: ""Am I not a cop? Everything is my b..."
links.text: "Am I not a cop? Everything is my business."

links.title: You: ""This is the second time you've avo..."
links.text: "This is the second time you've avoided the subject."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh my god! What is your *obsession..."
links.text: "Oh my god! What is your *obsession* with this Sylvie person? Get over it!"

links.title: Empathy: "Maybe it's he who's obsessed with "..."
links.text: Maybe it's he who's obsessed with "this Sylvie person"? Certainly sounds like it.

links.title: You: ""Fine.""
links.text: "Fine."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Extra fine.""
links.text: "Extra fine."

links.title: You: ""Are you the bartender?""
links.text: "Are you the bartender?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, I'm not the *bartender*. I'm t..."
links.text: "No, I'm not the *bartender*. I'm the cafeteria manager."

links.title: Empathy: "He's very animated all of a sudden...."
links.text: He's very animated all of a sudden. This is clearly a touchy subject for him.

links.title: You: ""What's the difference?""
links.text: "What's the difference?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I have *three* cafeterias I manage..."
links.text: "I have *three* cafeterias I manage. Three. Get over it."

links.title: You: ""You look like a bartender.""
links.text: "You look like a bartender."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""That period of my life is over. No..."
links.text: "That period of my life is over. Not everyone who stands behind a counter is a bartender, okay? I'm the cafeteria manager."

links.title: You: ""But you can still pour me a drink,..."
links.text: "But you can still pour me a drink, right?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I could if I were a bartender. But..."
links.text: "I could if I were a bartender. But I'm not, I'm the cafeteria manager. So I won't."

links.title: Suggestion: "There may be some way to get a drin..."
links.text: There may be some way to get a drink out of him (even for you) but this is not it.

links.title: You: ""Understood.""
links.text: "Understood."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I hope it is.""
links.text: "I hope it is."

links.title: You: ""What is your problem with me?""
links.text: "What is your problem with me?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Why would I have a problem with yo..."
links.text: "Why would I have a problem with you? You're a hero cop."

links.title: You: ""So not only am I a cop, but I'm al..."
links.text: "So not only am I a cop, but I'm also a hero?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes, you are!" He looks at you wit..."
links.text: "Yes, you are!" He looks at you with mock admiration. "A real decorated hero."

links.title: You: ""What did I do?""
links.text: "What did I do?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What did you *not* do? First you t..."
links.text: "What did you *not* do? First you took the body down, then you solved the murder, then you *didn't* trash my hostel room. Maybe you even negotiated the strike?"

links.title: You: ""You're being sarcastic.""
links.text: "You're being sarcastic."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Am I? Or did you ride in, take the..."
links.text: "Am I? Or did you ride in, take the body down, solve the murder, and *not* trash my hostel room?"

links.title: You: ""I'm guessing I didn't do any of th..."
links.text: "I'm guessing I didn't do any of those things?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You're right, you didn't. And it's..."
links.text: "You're right, you didn't. And it's only taken you *three days* not to."

links.title: You: ""What have I been doing all that ti..."
links.text: "What have I been doing all that time? Have you seen me around?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, I haven't *seen you around*. I..."
links.text: "No, I haven't *seen you around*. I just got here, remember?" He looks at you, then at the lieutenant. "Was there anything else?"

links.title: You: ""Oh my god, I did all those things?""
links.text: "Oh my god, I did all those things?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No -- you see -- actually you didn..."
links.text: "No -- you see -- actually you didn't. You haven't done anything even remotely useful since you got here."

links.title: You: ""What have I been doing then? Have..."
links.text: "What have I been doing then? Have you seen me around?"

links.title: You: ""I do not appreciate your tone. Thi..."
links.text: "I do not appreciate your tone. This is no way to talk to an officer."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh, it's not?!" He raises his shou..."
links.text: "Oh, it's not?!" He raises his shoulders like he's about to say something more, but then gets a hold of himself.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You're right. It's not.""
links.text: "You're right. It's not."

links.title: Authority: "He has no respect for you personall..."
links.text: He has no respect for you personally, but this man sees himself as a law-abiding citizen -- and you a representative of that law.

links.title: You: ""That's all.""
links.text: "That's all."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let's go.""
links.text: "Let's go."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Not so fast Mr. Feminist." He poin..."
links.text: "Not so fast Mr. Feminist." He points to you. "You owe me 130 reál."

links.title: Inland Empire: "No one is saying the multi-patterne..."
links.text: No one is saying the multi-patterned necktie you found tied to the ceiling fan can *talk*. No one. It must be merely *imagination*, but...

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Let's bail! Time to push the EJECT..."
links.text: Let's bail! Time to push the EJECT button. Sounds like a *responsibility*. You don't like those.

links.title: Volition: "No, don't listen to him. It's madne..."
links.text: No, don't listen to him. It's madness -- just *talk*.

links.title: You: ""What's *real*?""
links.text: "What's *real*?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh, excuse me. You owe me 130 *reá..."
links.text: "Oh, excuse me. You owe me 130 *reál*." He pronounces the 'r' with a mock aristocratic accent.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The IIR or interisolary reál is the..."
links.text: The IIR or interisolary reál is the global reserve currency. Whatever part of the world you're in right now, it's safe to assume he means you owe him some money.

links.title: You: ""By *real* do you mean some form of..."
links.text: "By *real* do you mean some form of street cred?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, you don't owe me street cred...."
links.text: "No, you don't owe me street cred. You owe me money. You owe this establishment 130 reál." He points to the red ledger on the counter.

links.title: You: ""Oh, I understand, you mean I owe y..."
links.text: "Oh, I understand, you mean I owe you money."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Wow, you're a genius! Yes, that's..."
links.text: "Wow, you're a genius! Yes, that's right -- money. You owe this establishment 130 reál." He points to the red ledger on the counter.

links.title: You: ""*Reál* sounds like some fancy skin..."
links.text: "*Reál* sounds like some fancy skin care product... but why would I owe you one hundred and thirty of them?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You owe me *money*, not a skin car..."
links.text: "You owe me *money*, not a skin care product. Money. You owe this establishment 130 reál." He points to the red ledger on the counter.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Reál? Must be cosmetics. Probably a..."
links.text: Reál? Must be cosmetics. Probably a body milk.

links.title: You: "Slip away unnoticed."
links.text: Slip away unnoticed.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "As you blow this joint -- behind yo..."
links.text: As you blow this joint -- behind you a whiny voice shouts:

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Real mature, man! Real mature.""
links.text: "Real mature, man! Real mature."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "One moment you're running like the..."
links.text: One moment you're running like the wind, then you've suddenly turned around and are giving him the finger. Furiously, with both hands. Why?!

links.title: You: "The lady in the wheel-chair is righ..."
links.text: The lady in the wheel-chair is right behind me, isn't she?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "That's true, yes. And it's worrying..."
links.text: That's true, yes. And it's worrying. But let's not *fixate* on it. Look at that stupid bartender instead -- he has no idea what's going on! You and your fuck-you-fingers floating in the air. Barkeep's got his mouth agape like an idiot. You showed him.

links.title: You: "Why did I do this? Why did I have u..."
links.text: Why did I do this? Why did I have use *both* my hands to flip him off? Why both...

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""WATCH OUT!!""
links.text: "WATCH OUT!!"

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Everything goes dark."
links.text: Everything goes dark.

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "Back so soon?"
links.text: Back so soon?

links.title: You: "I had an accident."
links.text: I had an accident.

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "It was no accident. Those were *dis..."
links.text: It was no accident. Those were *disco moves* from your Spinal Cord. The Spinal Cord has yet to reveal itself to you -- its mysteries are unholy mysteries.

links.title: You: "Wow, there's more of you? Hidden? I..."
links.text: Wow, there's more of you? Hidden? I'm so cool.

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "You are *way* cool, cooler than the..."
links.text: You are *way* cool, cooler than the bottom of the sea. Too cool for this world.

links.title: You: "I don't know... that just comes off..."
links.text: I don't know... that just comes off as a lazy effort at re-conceptualizing the antics of a shambling drunk.

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "If it comes off like that, it's bec..."
links.text: If it comes off like that, it's because it *is*. And you *are*.

links.title: You: "So worth it."
links.text: So worth it.

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "Admit it, you just missed the quart..."
links.text: Admit it, you just missed the quarter-light. The darkness on the edge of town.

links.title: Limbic System: "How's it going out there? Are the t..."
links.text: How's it going out there? Are the tiny apes screaming about money yet?

links.title: You: ""It's not going very well.""
links.text: "It's not going very well."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""It doesn't look like it is, sweeti..."
links.text: "It doesn't look like it is, sweetie. Are you okay?" An old woman appears out of the blackness.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "No. You have sustained a trauma to..."
links.text: No. You have sustained a trauma to your lower neck. In addition, you have strained your left trapezius muscle. Pain surges down your back when you move.

links.title: You: ""No, are *you* okay?""
links.text: "No, are *you* okay?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""The chair took the brunt of it. Do..."
links.text: "The chair took the brunt of it. Don't worry."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Are you sure, ma'am?""
links.text: "Are you sure, ma'am?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Yes, yes -- check on him!""
links.text: "Yes, yes -- check on him!"

links.title: You: ""Ouch.""
links.text: "Ouch."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Ma'am, are you alright?""
links.text: "Ma'am, are you alright?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, I'm fine. He just tripped over..."
links.text: "Oh, I'm fine. He just tripped over my chair -- check on him!" She looks at you with concern.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Sir, I didn't mean for this to hap..."
links.text: "Sir, I didn't mean for this to happen. I'm sorry, this has always been a cop-friendly place..." The man seems shaken by the incident.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""The drinks are on the house, okay?..."
links.text: "The drinks are on the house, okay? There were *a lot* of drinks on the tab. I still have to charge you for three nights and the broken window, though -- that's 100 square."

links.title: Pain Threshold: "With your back against the cold mos..."
links.text: With your back against the cold mosaic floor you feel the pain recede. You just need to get up and dust yourself off...

links.title: Rhetoric: "He's shaken. Barter now and he'll c..."
links.text: He's shaken. Barter now and he'll cave in.

links.title: You: ""I won't pay for that window... ouc..."
links.text: "I won't pay for that window... ouch." (Grab your side.)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Okay, fine. I'll take it off your..."
links.text: "Okay, fine. I'll take it off your bill! Sleep in a post-apocalyptic hell-hole if you want to. Just know I won't give you another room."

links.title: You: ""Cool.""
links.text: "Cool."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Not *entirely* cool. You still owe..."
links.text: "Not *entirely* cool. You still owe me 60 reál for three nights stay. If you don't have it by tonight, I can't let you back up there..." He points upstairs, toward your room.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""And for god's sake watch out for y..."
links.text: "And for god's sake watch out for yourself."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Not *entirely* cool. You still owe..."
links.text: "Not *entirely* cool. You still owe me 100 reál. If you don't have it by tonight, I can't let you back up there..." He points upstairs, toward your room.

links.title: You: ""Thank you for your cooperation.""
links.text: "Thank you for your cooperation."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Don't thank me yet. You still owe..."
links.text: "Don't thank me yet. You still owe me 60 reál for three nights stay. If you don't have it by tonight, I just can't let you up there..." He points upstairs, toward your room.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Don't thank me yet. You still owe..."
links.text: "Don't thank me yet. You still owe me 100 reál. If you don't have it by tonight, I just can't let you up there..." He points upstairs, toward your room.

links.title: You: ""I'm not very okay.""
links.text: "I'm not very okay."

links.title: You: ""I'm doing fine.""
links.text: "I'm doing fine."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""It doesn't look so, sweetie. Are y..."
links.text: "It doesn't look so, sweetie. Are you okay?" An old woman appears out of the blackness.

links.title: You: ""I think the tiny apes have started..."
links.text: "I think the tiny apes have started screaming, yes."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Did one of these "tiny apes" have..."
links.text: "Did one of these "tiny apes" have a pale green face?" An old woman appears out of the blackness.

links.title: You: ""Yes!""
links.text: "Yes!"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""It's a joke, sweetie. I didn't act..."
links.text: "It's a joke, sweetie. I didn't actually think you saw the Kind Green Ape of South Safre in a hostel in Martinaise. That would be ridiculous. Are you okay?"

links.title: You: ""What?""
links.text: "What?"

links.title: You: ""No, I don't think so.""
links.text: "No, I don't think so."

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "I was wrong to let you go. I should..."
links.text: I was wrong to let you go. I should have kept you here... is it bright where you are? Is it TERRIFYING? Have you felt THE LOVE?!

links.title: You: ""I sure as hell haven't felt no lov..."
links.text: "I sure as hell haven't felt no love!"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""That is too bad." An old woman app..."
links.text: "That is too bad." An old woman appears out of the blackness. "We all need a little love. Are you okay?"

links.title: You: ""It's okay. It's going fine.""
links.text: "It's okay. It's going fine."

links.title: You: ""What do you mean?""
links.text: "What do you mean?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""What do you mean what do I mean?"..."
links.text: "What do you mean what do I mean?" An old woman appears out of the blackness. "Are you okay?"

links.title: You: "This did not need to happen. I gave..."
links.text: This did not need to happen. I gave no such commands to my body.

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "Those are the mysteries of the Spin..."
links.text: Those are the mysteries of the Spinal Cord. The Spinal Cord has yet to reveal itself to you -- its mysteries are unholy mysteries.

links.title: You: ""Fuck you, asshole!""
links.text: "Fuck you, asshole!"

links.title: You: ""I don't owe you shit.""
links.text: "I don't owe you shit."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh!" He puffs with indignation. "Y..."
links.text: "Oh!" He puffs with indignation. "You don't owe me *shit*? Well, officer, you're right -- you *don't* owe me shit, you owe me MONEY."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He turns to you, calmly. "We do not..."
links.text: He turns to you, calmly. "We do not need to assert ourselves here. We only need instructions from him. This is the proprietor, remember?"

links.title: You: ""No! He called me a f****t!""
links.text: "No! He called me a f****t!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But, you see, he didn't.""
links.text: "But, you see, he didn't."

links.title: You: ""Sounded like extortion to me.""
links.text: "Sounded like extortion to me."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You know, I get this all the time...."
links.text: "You know, I get this all the time. Some hobo comes in here, or some backpacking asshole off the boat. The next day when they can't make their fees they get *aggressive*. I just never thought I'd be in this shit with a cop. Please, just give me the money..."

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Who does that CLOWN think he is? Ar..."
links.text: Who does that CLOWN think he is? Arrest him!

links.title: You: "Did I just hear my tie speak to me..."
links.text: Did I just hear my tie speak to me *twice*?

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "No one is saying that. No one is sa..."
links.text: No one is saying that. No one is saying the tie can talk -- that would be ludicrous. It's just that... you should arrest him. It would be *wiser*. He wants to take your money.

links.title: You: "I'm not comfortable with this. (Try..."
links.text: I'm not comfortable with this. (Try to somehow tuck the tie away.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant watches you fiddle w..."
links.text: The lieutenant watches you fiddle with your horrific tie, sweat stains forming under your armpits. He puts his hand on your shoulder.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""If you don't have the money, it's..."
links.text: "If you don't have the money, it's okay. None of us are in this for the wages."

links.title: Authority: "That's cop for: "I haven't offered..."
links.text: That's cop for: "I haven't offered to pay because I don't have any money either."

links.title: You: "Great advice, I'm considering it. (..."
links.text: Great advice, I'm considering it. (Give the tie an affirmative tug.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks at you tugging..."
links.text: The lieutenant looks at you tugging on your garish tie. He puts his hand on your shoulder:

links.title: You: "No way, I have duties. I'm a cop, I..."
links.text: No way, I have duties. I'm a cop, I'm not talking to a tie. (Take the tie off.)

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Somehow the knot is stuck so you ca..."
links.text: Somehow the knot is stuck so you can't get it off. The lieutenant watches you struggle with it, the sweat dripping from your brow. He puts his hand on your shoulder:

links.title: You: ""What do I owe this place for?""
links.text: "What do I owe this place for?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Let's see." He dramatically turns..."
links.text: "Let's see." He dramatically turns a page in the ledger. "Three nights at a tariff of 20 reál comes to 60 reál. Then there's the window you *annihilated* -- the hole in the window was the first thing I saw when I came to work, so don't try to tell me you didn't! That will be 40 reál in damages."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Another thing you've annihilated i..."
links.text: "Another thing you've annihilated is half the bar -- you've run a tab of 30 reál. Actually more, but we'll round it down to 30 for your hard work maintaining the stability and order of Revachol. That's 60 + 40 + 30 = 130 reál. And yes, reál is still money."

links.title: You: ""But what exactly *is* money?""
links.text: "But what exactly *is* money?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What are you, a philosopher?""
links.text: "What are you, a philosopher?"

links.title: You: ""Actually, I might be.""
links.text: "Actually, I might be."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Money is what grown up people use..."
links.text: "Money is what grown up people use to pay for things. Things like this hostel room or..." He peeks into the ledger: "...or eight bottles of 'Potent Blend' and nine packs of 'Royal Extra'. We use it for everything, really."

links.title: You: ""Where can I get money?""
links.text: "Where can I get money?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Are you serious? From your work, I..."
links.text: "Are you serious? From your work, I don't know... you can take bribes, I guess." He looks at the lieutenant. "I'm sorry. I don't think cops take bribes."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Some do take recompense." The lieu..."
links.text: "Some do take recompense." The lieutenant is dead serious. "But only to survive."

links.title: You: ""Why do I need it?""
links.text: "Why do I need it?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""For survival, to pay *me*. Unless..."
links.text: "For survival, to pay *me*. Unless you want to become a *hobo*? Do you want to become a hobo? There's nowhere else to stay in Martinaise and it's a cold spring outside. Money doesn't make you happy but it lets you be *un*happy for a while longer."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""If you run out of money, you die...."
links.text: "If you run out of money, you die. It's like that for all of us -- me too. That's why I need you to pay me." He stops and says, mostly to himself: "I'm not an asshole."

links.title: You: ""But what if I don't have any?" (Pr..."
links.text: "But what if I don't have any?" (Proceed.)
There's a shuffle of nylon as Lieutenant Kitsuragi looks for something in the pockets of his orange bomber.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "That's cop for: "I haven't offered..."
links.text: That's cop for: "I haven't offered to pay because I don't have any money either."

links.title: You: "(Proceed and show him the coins you..."
links.text: (Proceed and show him the coins you found.) "Is this money?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes. It is.""
links.text: "Yes. It is."

links.title: You: "(Count them and give them to him.)..."
links.text: (Count them and give them to him.) "That's 10 plus 10 plus 20 equals 40. I'm now down to 90, right?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, you see..." There's a tinge of..."
links.text: "No, you see..." There's a tinge of sadness in his voice. "That's 40 *cents*. Cents are a form of currency one hundred times smaller than the reál. I'm not even going to take this. Come back when you have 130 reál."

links.title: You: ""One *hundred* times smaller?""
links.text: "One *hundred* times smaller?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: You: ""But that's horrible.""
links.text: "But that's horrible."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""It is." He stands silently looking..."
links.text: "It is." He stands silently looking at the coppers on the counter.

links.title: Suggestion: "For a moment, his antipathy is over..."
links.text: For a moment, his antipathy is overcome by compassion for the sheer smallness of the money.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Isn't it... evil? The order of magn..."
links.text: Isn't it... evil? The order of magnitude between what is asked of a person -- and what they have?

links.title: You: ""Darkness rides." (Pick up the coin..."
links.text: "Darkness rides." (Pick up the coins.)

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""It does, doesn't it.""
links.text: "It does, doesn't it."

links.title: You: "Keep it to yourself and pick up the..."
links.text: Keep it to yourself and pick up the coins.

links.title: You: "Pick up the coins."
links.text: Pick up the coins.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He demonstratively suppresses a wor..."
links.text: He demonstratively suppresses a world-weary sigh.

links.title: You: ""Okay.""
links.text: "Okay."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He stands silently looking at the c..."
links.text: He stands silently looking at the coppers on the counter.

links.title: You: "Keep the money."
links.text: Keep the money.

links.title: You: "(Proceed, but don't show him the co..."
links.text: (Proceed, but don't show him the coins. They're *yours*.)

links.title: You: ""I don't think I have *any* money."..."
links.text: "I don't think I have *any* money." (Proceed.)

links.title: You: ""Since I woke up I have trouble rem..."
links.text: "Since I woke up I have trouble remembering even the most basic concepts of reality."

links.title: You: ""No, I'm just getting my bearings.""
links.text: "No, I'm just getting my bearings."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""What are you, brain-damaged?""
links.text: "What are you, brain-damaged?"

links.title: You: ""You're under arrest.""
links.text: "You're under arrest."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You can't arrest me, I haven't don..."
links.text: "You can't arrest me, I haven't done anything."

links.title: You: ""Okay, you're not under arrest.""
links.text: "Okay, you're not under arrest."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Tsk..." He rolls his eyes."
links.text: "Tsk..." He rolls his eyes.

links.title: You: "Put this man in his place."
links.text: Put this man in his place.

links.title: Authority: "From the bottom of your blue soul,..."
links.text: From the bottom of your blue soul, a term emerges:

links.title: You: ""'Refusal to aid an officer of the..."
links.text: "'Refusal to aid an officer of the peace.' You are impeding me from carrying out a murder investigation with your inane requests for money."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""But it's not inane, I just... you..."
links.text: "But it's not inane, I just... you owe me money."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It is crude of you. A man has been..."
links.text: "It is crude of you. A man has been killed. File a request for compensation with Station 41. We need to work now."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Okay, you'll only have to pay for..."
links.text: "Okay, you'll only have to pay for the window. And the drinks. That's 70. I'll get the rest from your stupid station."

links.title: You: ""I have no memory of drinking them...."
links.text: "I have no memory of drinking them. I'm not paying for the drinks."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""The ledger does! The ledger has a..."
links.text: "The ledger does! The ledger has a memory!" He points to the book. "The drinks are non-negotiable, there's no way your station will pay for them."

links.title: You: ""I won't pay for the window.""
links.text: "I won't pay for the window."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Fine, I'll take it off the bill! Y..."
links.text: "Fine, I'll take it off the bill! You want to sleep in a post-apocalyptic shit-hole, go ahead! But I'm not giving you another room."

links.title: You: ""Cool." [Leave.]"
links.text: "Cool." [Leave.]

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""No, not *cool*. You still owe me 3..."
links.text: "No, not *cool*. You still owe me 30 for the drinks. If you don't have it by tonight I'm not letting you back up there..." He points upstairs.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's enough now, sir. Good day.""
links.text: "That's enough now, sir. Good day."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You still owe me 70. If you don't..."
links.text: "You still owe me 70. If you don't have it by tonight I'm not letting you back up there," he points upstairs.

links.title: You: ""Goodbye and thank you for your coo..."
links.text: "Goodbye and thank you for your cooperation." [Leave.]

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Don't thank me. You still owe me 3..."
links.text: "Don't thank me. You still owe me 30 for the drinks! If you don't have it by tonight I'm not letting you back up there..." He points upstairs.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Don't thank me. You still owe me 7..."
links.text: "Don't thank me. You still owe me 70. If you don't have it by tonight I'm not letting you back up there," he points upstairs.

links.title: You: ""I wonder what Sylvie has to say ab..."
links.text: "I wonder what Sylvie has to say about that?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Are you trying to frighten me now?..."
links.text: "Are you trying to frighten me now?" He turns to the lieutenant: "What is this?"

links.title: You: ""This is me threatening you with ex..."
links.text: "This is me threatening you with excruciating legal procedures, because you're impeding my investigation."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Fine, fuck this. I'll do it myself..."
links.text: "Fine, fuck this. I'll do it myself, I'll call your station... what was it, 41? I'll ask them to pay for the room. The drinks and the window you still have to pay for. That's 70. Are we done, officers?"

links.title: You: ""You tell me what this is? Did you..."
links.text: "You tell me what this is? Did you *rape* her?"

links.title: You: ""You have admitted to *sexual* crim..."
links.text: "You have admitted to *sexual* crimes. You will be taken to *sex* prison."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He laughs. "What in the name of God..."
links.text: He laughs. "What in the name of God..."

links.title: You: ""Sounds like you think *sex* is mor..."
links.text: "Sounds like you think *sex* is more than a social construct. Tell me, do you think women are mentally inferior to men?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Okay, okay..." He settles down. "I..."
links.text: "Okay, okay..." He settles down. "I know what is going on -- and okay. I'll call your station... what did you say it was?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Forty one," the lieutenant steps i..."
links.text: "Forty one," the lieutenant steps in.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I'll call them for recompensation..."
links.text: "I'll call them for recompensation for the room. But you still owe me 70 for the drinks and the window. And I do *not* think women are mentally inferior to men."

links.title: Authority: "The words leave your mouth as if wa..."
links.text: The words leave your mouth as if walking up the stairs -- everything is going fine until you reach the end and take one step too many:

links.title: You: ""I fucking well can, *bitch*!""
links.text: "I fucking well can, *bitch*!"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Oh, so apparently I'm a *bitch* no..."
links.text: "Oh, so apparently I'm a *bitch* now. Okay, I'll be the 'bitch', and you'll be the broke cop who owes me money, and no one will arrest anyone because that's insane. How's that?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Sir, leash in your tongue." The li..."
links.text: "Sir, leash in your tongue." The lieutenant's voice is controlled, yet threatening. Like it's coming from a different person.

links.title: Authority: "The words nail the Cafeteria Manage..."
links.text: The words nail the Cafeteria Manager to his place. Unmoving he stares down at the counter with his cheeks reddish.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Officer," he turns to you. "You ne..."
links.text: "Officer," he turns to you. "You need to contact your station. Ask your people for assistance with the money you owe this place. There is a shortwave radio in my car, when you get the time, use it. We need to get this investigation started now."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I'm sorry, but I can't let him sta..."
links.text: "I'm sorry, but I can't let him stay here if he doesn't pay... He's three days on the slip. If he doesn't have the money by tonight, he'll have to work this from home."

links.title: You: ""Isn't there somewhere else I can s..."
links.text: "Isn't there somewhere else I can stay around here?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You can look, but... the Union squ..."
links.text: "You can look, but... the Union squeezed most people out of business to fund the strike. So, I don't know... your best shot is just going home."

links.title: You: ""I don't have a home.""
links.text: "I don't have a home."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay..." The lieutenant lets out a..."
links.text: "Okay..." The lieutenant lets out a heavy sigh. "Let's go. Goodbye, sir."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Good luck.""
links.text: "Good luck."

links.title: You: ""I don't remember where my home is.""
links.text: "I don't remember where my home is."

links.title: You: ""Fuck this place. I'll take my chan..."
links.text: "Fuck this place. I'll take my chances on the streets."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, there's no need..." The lieute..."
links.text: "No, there's no need..." The lieutenant is silent for a moment. "Let's go. Goodbye, sir."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "The man stands silently behind the..."
links.text: The man stands silently behind the counter, with his eyes fixed on the broken taxidermy, then on the ledger. He does not know what to say anymore.

links.title: You: ""I'll see what I can do.""
links.text: "I'll see what I can do."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "The man starts to say something, bu..."
links.text: The man starts to say something, but then thinks better of it. "Good luck."

links.title: Authority: "The words nail the man to his place..."
links.text: The words nail the man to his place. Unmoving, he stares down at the counter with his cheeks reddish.

links.title: You: ""I don't know why I said that. I th..."
links.text: "I don't know why I said that. I thought it's something a cop would say."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I don't really need you to *say* a..."
links.text: "I don't really need you to *say* anything, I just need the money."

links.title: You: ""What happens now?""
links.text: "What happens now?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "He turns to the lieutenant. "I'm so..."
links.text: He turns to the lieutenant. "I'm sorry, but he has to pay, I can't let him stay here any longer if he doesn't. If he doesn't have the money by tonight, then..." He shrugs.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Officer, maybe you're better off w..."
links.text: "Officer, maybe you're better off working this from home for now? You live in Jamrock, right? It's not that far away."

links.title: You: ""Isn't there somewhere else I can s..."
links.text: "Isn't there somewhere else I can stay around here?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""You mean somewhere else to run up..."
links.text: "You mean somewhere else to run up a huge debt? I don't think so. The Union squeezed most places out of business to fund the strike. You're better off home."

links.title: You: ""I don't have a home.""
links.text: "I don't have a home."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Officer..." A pattern of creases a..."
links.text: "Officer..." A pattern of creases appears on his forehead. "You really need to take this up with your station, I have a shortwave radio in my car. Call them, ask for assistance. We have to get this investigation started now."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "The man wants to say something, the..."
links.text: The man wants to say something, then thinks better of it. "Good luck."

links.title: You: ""I don't remember where my home is.""
links.text: "I don't remember where my home is."

links.title: You: ""Fuck this place. I'll take my chan..."
links.text: "Fuck this place. I'll take my chances on the streets."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, don't, there's no need..." A p..."
links.text: "No, don't, there's no need..." A pattern of creases appears on his forehead. "You really need to take this up with your station, I have a shortwave radio in my car. Call them, ask for assistance. We have to get this investigation started now."

links.title: You: ""I'll see what I can do.""
links.text: "I'll see what I can do."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm sorry I couldn't help more." C..."
links.text: "I'm sorry I couldn't help more." Creases line his forehead, above the spectacles. "You should take this up with your station, I have a shortwave radio in my car, okay? We have to get this investigation started now."

links.title: You: ""Alright, calm down. What is this a..."
links.text: "Alright, calm down. What is this about?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Not so fast." He points to you. "Y..."
links.text: "Not so fast." He points to you. "You owe me 130 reál."

links.title: You: ""You know, I actually can't think o..."
links.text: "You know, I actually can't think of a single thing."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I knew it.""
links.text: "I knew it."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I have three cafeterias to manage...."
links.text: "I have three cafeterias to manage. *Three*. Sylvie tends the bar here, not me, I'm only standing in."

links.title: You: ""Where did this Sylvie go?""
links.text: "Where did this Sylvie go?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""She just, you know..." He shrugs."
links.text: "She just, you know..." He shrugs.

links.title: Drama: "His eyes dart from left to right. T..."
links.text: His eyes dart from left to right. This man isn't lying, but he *is* hiding something.

links.title: You: ""She just... what?""
links.text: "She just... what?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""So *now* you're a cop? Forget it.""
links.text: "So *now* you're a cop? Forget it."

links.title: You: ""Okay, then.""
links.text: "Okay, then."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Mhm.""
links.text: "Mhm."

links.title: Empathy: "There's something there and it's no..."
links.text: There's something there and it's not good. That's all you know for now.

links.title: You: ""You look like a bartender.""
links.text: "You look like a bartender."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""That period of my life is over. No..."
links.text: "That period of my life is over. Not everyone who stands behind a counter is a bartender, okay? I'm the cafeteria manager."

links.title: You: ""But you can still pour me a drink,..."
links.text: "But you can still pour me a drink, right?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I could if I were a bartender. But..."
links.text: "I could if I were a bartender. But I'm not, I'm the cafeteria manager. So I won't."

links.title: Suggestion: "There may be some way to get a drin..."
links.text: There may be some way to get a drink out of him (even for you) but this is not it.

links.title: You: ""Understood.""
links.text: "Understood."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Mhm.""
links.text: "Mhm."

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "A man in his late twenties stands b..."
dialogueTree.text: A man in his late twenties stands behind the counter, inspecting a stuffed seabird. As you approach, he gives you a sideways glance, then looks down again.

links.title: Empathy: "That was disdain in his eyes. Even..."
links.text: That was disdain in his eyes. Even now he is purposefully ignoring you. Looks like he's not a fan.

links.title: Empathy: "Everything is cool between you and..."
links.text: Everything is cool between you and this guy. He's a big fan. Make some small talk.

links.title: Empathy: "That was disdain in his eyes. Even..."
links.text: That was disdain in his eyes. Even now he's purposefully ignoring you.
